!cups | JuJuBee: I know, but I don't see an option for Parallel
does the computer HAVE a paralel port, it is enabled in BIOS?
is parport0 loaded as a module?
then go looat at /var/log/cups/error_log and see why it does not like the port
when you looked at dmesg did parport0 show a printer attached?
go into your BIOS and turn on EPP
it seems to have found it but test page printing gibberish
that is a matter of selecting a proper PPD, make sure you select one that matches the capability of the printer
also did you enable DMA for it?
thanks, was the wron ppd.  I chose 810 ps/foomatic or something like that.  Switched to 800 laserjet.
im glad it works, also if you did not already do so, enable DMA for the EPP on that port
DMA is not necessary.  Its just nice to have so you dont hold up your kernel while sending bits to the printer
